### POST /blacklists/

This endpoint allows the client to add an email to the blacklist along with additional details.

#### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email address to be blacklisted.
    
- app_uuid (string, required): The UUID of the application.
    
- reason (string, required): The reason for blacklisting the email.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "data": {
    "app_uuid": "",
    "created_at": "",
    "email": "",
    "id": 0,
    "ip_address": "",
    "reason": ""
  },
  "message": ""
}

 ```

- data (object): Contains the details of the blacklisted email.
    
    - app_uuid (string): The UUID of the application.
        
    - created_at (string): The timestamp of when the email was blacklisted.
        
    - email (string): The blacklisted email address.
        
    - id (integer): The unique identifier of the blacklisted entry.
        
    - ip_address (string): The IP address from which the request was made.
        
    - reason (string): The reason for blacklisting the email.
        
- message (string): Additional information or status message.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
  "email": "test@example.com",
  "app_uuid": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614...",
  "reason": "Probando local"
}

 ```

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve the blacklist status for the email address "[test@example.com](https://mailto:test@example.com)".

### Request Body

This request does not contain a request body.

### Response Body

- `app_uuid`: The UUID of the application associated with the email address.
    
- `blacklisted`: Indicates whether the email address is blacklisted or not.
    
- `created_at`: The timestamp when the email address was added to the blacklist.
    
- `email`: The email address being checked for blacklist status.
    
- `reason`: The reason for blacklisting the email address.
    

The response is in JSON format with a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json.

### Get Blacklist Health

This endpoint retrieves the health status of the blacklists.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:5000/blacklists/health`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

``` json
{
    "status": ""
}

 ```
